results.title: Marvellous Melbourne
results.creator_credit: Charles Cozens Spencer and Spencer Productions
results.brief_description: In this silent film approximately 15 static and moving shots, including those from a cable car, are separated by intertitles. They take on a Lumiere look with the way that they picture Melbourne’s main streets and buildings that were prominent at the time. The different fashion and the horse and cart transportation are even more fascinating in this familiar setting.

results.title: [St Kilda Esplanade]
results.brief_description: Early footage of St Kilda, Victoria, showing the entrance to Luna Park with a group of people walking past and chatting outside the Daylight Picture Cinema next door. Ends with a group of people standing on a small jetty on the beach.

results.title: The Devil's toy
results.creator_credit: Claude Jutra, Marcel Martin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The skateboard gave the youngsters, who mastered its technique, a thrilling sensation of speed unexcelled by any other pavement sport. Filmed in 1966 on Montreal streets before the elongated rollerskate was banned, this film captures the exuberance of boys and girls having the time of their lives in free-wheeling downhill locomotion. Music by Pierre Brault. Sung by Genevieve Bujold.

results.title: Winter of our dreams
results.creator_credit: John Duigan, Richard Mason and Vega Film Productions
results.brief_description: An unstable relationship develops between prostitute Louise (Judy Davis), and a married man Rob (Bryan Brown), following the suicide of a mutual friend, Lisa. Lou (Davis), who is left with Lisa’s diaries becomes infatuated by her friend’s life and unrequited passion for Rob. She attempts to assume Lisa’s identity, in appearance, thoughts and actions, which poses the viewer with the question, will she too end her life? Lou sees in Rob an avenue for salvation from her life of drug addiction and prostitution. It is a destructive relationship, with Rob giving her little encouragement or hope. Rob is drawn to Lou for the possible insight she can offer into the years that passed between his sudden departure from Lisa and his now, unconventional marriage. Ultimately, it is a one sided relationship and Lou must decide whether she can make something of her life. Cast includes Bryan Brown, Judy Davis, Cathy Downes and Baz Luhrmann.

results.title: The Sentimental bloke
results.creator_credit: Raymond Longford and Southern Cross Film Co
results.brief_description: Classic adaptation of C.J. Dennis’ verse narrative of life in inner Sydney in the 1910s, rich in incident but centring on the romance and marriage of the Bloke and Doreen. Filmed on location in Sydney’s Woolloomooloo and the Hornsby Valley (the orchard scene), it was ahead of its time in the naturalness of the performances from a carefully chosen cast. Starring Arthur Tauchert, Lottie Lyell and Gilbert Emery.

results.title: Tandberg on page one
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Education Dept. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: Ron Tandberg is Australia’s best known political cartoonist. This film follows through Tandberg’s work on the front page of the Melbourne ‘Age’ on one particular night’s edition. This document is significant for its depiction of the production of a broadsheet newspaper (including it printing) in 1983 and the dramatic change in production since computerisation was introduced shortly afterwards.

results.title: First contact
results.creator_credit: Stewart Young, Dick Smith Adventure, Robin Anderson, Bob Connolly and Arundel Productions
results.brief_description: Documents the clash of two cultures that occurred in the 1930s when the people of the highlands of New Guinea encountered the first Europeans to enter their world. One of these Australians, Michael Leahy, took a movie camera with him.

constellations_other.name: Bob Connolly
constellations_other.description: Australian audiences just can't seem to get enough of exploring local governments, bureaucracy and politics, whether that's through documentaries or biting social satire.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Stewart Young, Dick Smith Adventure, Robin Anderson, Bob Connolly and Arundel Productions
results.description: Documents the clash of two cultures that occurred in the 1930s when the people of the highlands of New Guinea encountered the first Europeans to enter their world - for an El Dorado. One of these Australians, Michael Leahy, took a movie camera with him, and so managed to capture on film the confrontation between one civilisation and the representatives of another.
description_for_label: Documents the clash of two cultures that occurred in the 1930s when the people of the highlands of New Guinea encountered the first Europeans to enter their world - for an El Dorado. One of these Australians, Michael Leahy, took a movie camera with him, and so managed to capture on film the confrontation between one civilisation and the representatives of another.

results.title: Lousy Little Sixpence
results.creator_credit: Alec Morgan, Gerald Bostock and Sixpence Productions
results.brief_description: Archival film footage, photographs and the memories of Aboriginal elders weave a moving account of the lives of Aboriginal people and their struggle in the 1930s against the Aborigines Protection Board.

constellations_other.name: Setting the record straight
constellations_other.description: For too long, the history of Australia was only told in mainstream films through a white lens. First Nations people have used the camera as a means of truth-telling and setting the record straight for decades.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Alec Morgan, Gerald Bostock and Sixpence Productions
results.description: In 1909 the N.S.W. Aborigines Protection Board planned to break up Aboriginal communities by forcibly removing children and hiring them out to white “masters”. Archival film footage, photographs and the memories of Aboriginal elders weave a moving account of the lives of Aboriginal people and their struggle in the 1930s against the Aborigines Protection Board. Appearing in the film: Margaret Tucker, Bill Reid, Geraldine Briggs, Flo Caldwell, Violet Shea. Narrated by Chicka Dixon.
description_for_label: In 1909 the N.S.W. Aborigines Protection Board planned to break up Aboriginal communities by forcibly removing children and hiring them out to white “masters”. Archival film footage, photographs and the memories of Aboriginal elders weave a moving account of the lives of Aboriginal people and their struggle in the 1930s against the Aborigines Protection Board. Appearing in the film: Margaret Tucker, Bill Reid, Geraldine Briggs, Flo Caldwell, Violet Shea. Narrated by Chicka Dixon.

results.title: Northern Territory Contact. No. 12
results.creator_credit: Ian Walker, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Solar village. In the little township of Nguiu, on Bathurst Island a solar power plant run by Aborigines, has been built, which supplies electricity to the settlement of 800 people.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Walker, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia

results.title: Northern oasis
results.creator_credit: E.M. Jackson and Boort Progress Association
results.brief_description:
A silent film about life in the North-Western Victorian country town of Boort during the 1940s. Produced by and for the people of Boort and district.
The Loddon Weir is shown, as are: local livestock sales, dairy, poultry, pork and citrus farming, school children at the small local school and Australia Day celebrations with athletics, a fashion parade, tennis, lawn bowls and decorative boat river regatta. The film ends with the “Water - the life-blood of the North. The future progress and prosperity of this Northern-Oasis depend upon its assured supply.”
